channel.title: Introduction :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Hyper-Text Markup Language (HTML) alongside Hyper-Text Transfer Protocol (HTTP) formed the core of Sir Tim Berners-Leeâ€™s world-wide web. As the name implies, HTTP is a markup language, one that combines the text of what is being said with instructions on how to display it. The other aspect of HTML is its hyper-text nature. Hyper-text refers to text that links to additional resources - primarily the links in the document, but also embedded multimedia.
